The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.background_info:
As per the Olympic Committee’s [recommendations](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/strict-eligibility-conditions-in-place-as-ioc-eb-approves-individual-neutral-athletes-ains-for-the-olympic-games-paris-2024) from earlier this year, Russian and Belarusian athletes will be allowed to participate in the 2024 Games as long as they do so as so-called "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AINs), without an accompanying national flag or anthem.

The Russian Federation/Russian Olympic Committee has won an average of 19 gold medals in the last 3 Olympic Games, and Belarus has averaged  1.7.

Q.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes win more than 10 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
Q.body: This market will resolve to 'Yes' if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win more than 10 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise, the market will resolve to 'No'. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won more than 10 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to 'Yes'.

P_given_Q.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win more than 10 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will they win 21 or more gold medals?
P_given_Q.body:
This market will resolve to 'Yes' if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise, the market will resolve to 'No'. 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to 'Yes'. 

Condition: Individual Neutral Athletes must first collectively win more than 10 gold medals for this question to be relevant.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Individual Neutral Athletes do not win more than 10 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will they win 21 or more gold medals?
P_given_not_Q.body: This market will resolve to 'Yes' if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. This is in the context of the earlier question which resolves to 'Yes' if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 10 gold medals or fewer at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for both questions will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise, both markets will resolve to 'No'. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to 'Yes'. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 10 gold medals or fewer, then they cannot simultaneously win 21 or more gold medals.

Q.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes win more total medals than any single country at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
Q.body: This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win more total medals than any single country at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable.

P_given_Q.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win more total medals than any single country at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will they win 21 or more gold medals?
P_given_Q.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

The initial condition is that Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win more total medals than any single country at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, which will resolve to "Yes" if that occurs. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Individual Neutral Athletes do not win more total medals than any single country, will they win at least 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
P_given_not_Q.body: This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively do not win more total medals than any single country at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In addition, this market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for gold medals will also be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No". In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.background_info:
On April 1, 2024, an Israeli airstrike [targeted the Iranian embassy](https://apnews.com/article/israel-syria-airstrike-iranian-embassy-edca34c52d38c8bc57281e4ebf33b240) in Damascus, Syria, resulting in significant casualties including the deaths of top Iranian commanders. 

In the aftermath, the United States has increased its security posture in the region, anticipating a retaliatory strike by Iran against Israeli or American assets. Senior U.S. and Israeli officials [consider such an attack "inevitable."](https://www.cnn.com/2024/04/05/politics/us-israel-iran-retaliation-strike/index.html)

Q.title: Will Iran conduct a significant cyber attack against Israel before May 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that a cyber attack attributed to Iran has caused significant disruption to critical infrastructure in Israel.

P_given_Q.title: Given Iran conducts a significant cyber attack against Israel, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals, given that credible reports indicate that a cyber attack attributed to Iran has caused significant disruption to critical infrastructure in Israel. 

Resolution criteria: 
1. For P: A cyber attack attributed to Iran must cause significant disruption to critical infrastructure in Israel before May 1, 2024. 
2. For Q: An attack attributed to Iran must occur within Israel's borders and lead to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Iran will not conduct a significant cyber attack against Israel before May 1, 2024, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. The condition is based on the premise that there are no credible reports indicating that a cyber attack attributed to Iran has caused significant disruption to critical infrastructure in Israel.

Q.title: Will Iran conduct a military operation against Israeli targets outside of Israel before May 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that Iran has carried out a military operation targeting Israeli interests or personnel outside of Israel's borders.

P_given_Q.title: Given that Iran conducts a military operation against Israeli targets outside of Israel before May 1, 2024, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. The first condition is that credible reports indicate that Iran has carried out a military operation targeting Israeli interests or personnel outside of Israel's borders.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Iran will not conduct a military operation against Israeli targets outside of Israel before May 1, 2024, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. The condition is that there are no credible reports indicating that Iran has carried out a military operation targeting Israeli interests or personnel outside of Israel's borders before May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"}}>
</iframe>

metadata.background_info:
The [Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip_(2023–present)#27_October) commenced on October 27, 2023 in response to a [Hamas-led attack on Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel) on October 7, 2023 which saw over a thousand killed, and hundreds kidnapped.

The invasion was initially limited to Northern Gaza, but the plans were gradually expanded further South. Recently, Israel has [stated its intentions to expand its invasion to the Southern city of Rafah](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-02-12/israel-conducts-strikes-in-rafah-as-humanitarian-concerns-mount), which borders Egypt. These expansion plans, like prior ones, have seen widespread condemnation from both pro and anti-Israeli nations. This condemnation is primarily based on the alarming number of deaths and casualties stemming from the ground invasion; the growing humanitarian crisis, which has become more acute as the Israeli invasion has expanded; and the vast number of Palestinian refugees which are reportedly taking refuge in the city having fled from Northern Gaza.

Israel has already [commenced airstrikes and covert raids in Rafah](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-02-12/israel-conducts-strikes-in-rafah-as-humanitarian-concerns-mount), but a full-scale ground invasion has yet to commence.

Amongst the nations who have condemned the plans are the US - Israel's closest ally - and Egypt - Gaza's Southern neighbour which [has threatened](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/02/11/egypt-threatens-to-suspend-key-peace-treaty-if-israel-pushes-into-rafah-on-its-border-officials-say.html) to break it's 45 year old peace treaty with Israel if the ground invasion plans commence in Rafah.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has continued to state that an invasion is imminent and that Israel has a specific date set, though on April 9 it [was reported](https://www.axios.com/2024/04/09/israel-defense-gallant-deny-rafah-invasion-date) that Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant has said there is no date set.

Q.title: Will Israel launch a significant airstrike on Rafah before May 31, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve Yes if credible reports indicate that the Israeli military has conducted a significant airstrike in Rafah before May 31, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that Israel launches a significant airstrike on Rafah before May 31, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve Yes if credible reports indicate that the Israeli military has conducted a significant airstrike in Rafah before May 31, 2024. Additionally, it will resolve Yes if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Israel does not launch a significant airstrike on Rafah before May 31, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve Yes if there are no credible reports indicating that the Israeli military has conducted a significant airstrike in Rafah before May 31, 2024. Additionally, it will resolve Yes if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

Q.title: Will Israel launch a significant airstrike in Rafah before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve **Yes** if there are reports of a significant Israeli airstrike targeting Rafah before June 1, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that Israel launches a significant airstrike in Rafah before June 1, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if there are reports of a significant Israeli airstrike targeting Rafah before June 1, 2024. Additionally, it will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"></iframe>

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Israel does not launch a significant airstrike in Rafah before June 1, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve **Yes** if there are no reports of a significant Israeli airstrike targeting Rafah before June 1, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve **Yes** if the ISW reports Israeli military operations at any of the specified locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.background_info: In a significant escalation of regional tensions, [Iran launched a coordinated aerial attack targeting Israeli territory on April 13, 2024](https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/iran-tries-to-calibrate-response-against-israel-after-deadly-bombing-abb38b57). This action by Iran came as a direct retaliation for an [Israeli airstrike earlier in the month](https://apnews.com/article/israel-syria-airstrike-iranian-embassy-edca34c52d38c8bc57281e4ebf33b240#:~:text=An%20Israeli%20airstrike%20in%20a,at%20least%20five%20Iranian%20advisers.), which struck the Iranian Embassy complex in Damascus, Syria, which resulted in the deaths of seven Iranian officers, including three high-ranking commanders, intensifying Iran's resolve to respond.

Q.title: Will there be a significant military escalation between Israel and Iran before May 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there are credible reports of increased military actions or confrontations between Israel and Iran that indicate a significant escalation of hostilities before May 1, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given there is a significant military escalation between Israel and Iran before May 1, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there are credible reports of increased military actions or confrontations between Israel and Iran that indicate a significant escalation of hostilities before May 1, 2024. Additionally, it resolves Yes if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given no significant military escalation between Israel and Iran, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there are no credible reports of increased military actions or confrontations between Israel and Iran that indicate a significant escalation of hostilities before May 1, 2024. Furthermore, it resolves Yes if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Q.title: Will Israel conduct a military operation targeting Iranian nuclear facilities before May 1, 2024?

P_given_Q.title: Given that Israel conducts a military operation targeting Iranian nuclear facilities before May 1, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. The condition for this question is that Israel must conduct a military operation targeting Iranian nuclear facilities before May 1, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Israel will not conduct a military operation targeting Iranian nuclear facilities before May 1, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: Will Israel not conduct a military operation targeting Iranian nuclear facilities before May 1, 2024? If this is true, then will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

metadata.background_info:
The commencement of Donald Trump's [trial in the so-called "hush money" case](https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/4589001-5-things-to-know-ahead-of-trumps-hush-money-trial/) marks a historic moment as he becomes the first former U.S. president to face criminal charges in court. The trial centers around allegations that Trump, during the 2016 presidential campaign, orchestrated a hush money payment to an adult film actress to prevent damaging stories from surfacing. This payment, and similar transactions, are claimed by the Manhattan district attorney to have been unlawfully logged as legal expenses by Trump’s company.

The trial is scheduled to commence on April 15th, 2024 and is expected to last approximately six weeks.

*This question is part of the Q2 2024 Quarterly Cup, however, if the trial has not concluded when the tournament ends on July 8, 2024, it will not be scored in the Quarterly Cup. It will still count as part of the annual leaderboard.*

Q.title: Will Donald Trump be found guilty in the hush money trial?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that Donald Trump has been found guilty in the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

P_given_Q.title: Given Donald Trump is found guilty in the hush money trial, will he testify at the hush money trial?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. The condition for this question is that it is already established that credible sources report that Donald Trump has been found guilty in the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Donald Trump is not found guilty in the hush money trial, will he testify at the trial?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not found guilty in the hush money trial, which will resolve as Yes if there are no credible sources reporting that Donald Trump has been found guilty in the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Q.title: Will any other key witness testify at the hush money trial before June 15, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that any key witness has testified at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels before June 15, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any other key witness will testify at the hush money trial before June 15, 2024, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that any key witness has testified at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels before June 15, 2024. Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no other key witness will testify at the hush money trial before June 15, 2024, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: No credible sources report that any key witness has testified at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels before June 15, 2024. Then will Donald Trump testify at the trial? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

metadata.background_info:
When it comes to separatism and Moldova, most will likely recall Transnistria, which is controlled by separatists and elements of the Russian Federation armed forces since the 1990s.

However, another autonomous region of Moldova, [Gagauzia](https://www.clingendael.org/pub/2022/walking-the-tightrope-towards-the-eu/4-gagauzia-the-restless-region-in-the-south/), is currently undergoing major "temptation" from Russia. The region, inhabited by over 120,000 Gagauzes, who are an Orthodox, mostly Russian speaking Moldovan minority, is newly connected to the Mir banking system, Russian [propaganda](https://dfrlab.org/2024/03/19/kremlin-media-blitz-gagauzia/) is widely spreading (most TV channels are Russian), and control of the [Chisinau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chi%C8%99in%C4%83u) government is openly challenged.

The most important figure in this new development is Evghenia Guțul, a young pro-Russian politician, who was [elected](https://www.rferl.org/a/gutul-gagauzia-moldova-leader-shor-party/32412419.html) a governor of the region in the last year's elections, which brought a lot of controversy due to allegations of corruption and the fact that Guțul ran on a ticket of a banned Pro-Russian party (connected to the Russian oligarch Ilan Shor).

Guțul visited Russia twice in the last several weeks. The most recent [visit](https://balkaninsight.com/2024/04/10/moldovas-restive-gagauzia-region-mulls-using-russian-payment-cards/) occurred on the 8th of April, and before that on the 6th of March, during which she [met](https://balkaninsight.com/2024/03/07/pro-moscow-governor-of-moldovas-gagauzia-seeks-putins-help/) with Russian President Vladimir Putin (edit May 6, 2024: Guțul also appears to have been in Moscow when this question was launched, with a [meeting in Moscow on April 22](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldova-brings-criminal-case-against-pro-russian-gagauzia-leader-court-2024-04-24/) and on [April 24](https://twitter.com/EvgheniaGutul/status/1783236723297685785)).

In the aftermath of both visits Russia promised to "protect" Gagauzia and also to distribute monthly [payments](https://cepa.org/article/the-kremlin-decides-to-buy-a-population/) to Gagauzian civil servants and senior citizens (together accounting for approximately 25,000 people).

More Guțul visits in Russia might signal rapid development in this region, which could mean further deterioration of the relationship between Gagauzia and Moldovan government.

Q.title: Will Evghenia Guțul make an official statement regarding her travel plans to the Russian Federation before May 31, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has made an official statement about her travel plans to the Russian Federation before May 31, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given Evghenia Guțul makes an official statement regarding her travel plans, will she travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: Evghenia Guțul makes an official statement regarding her travel plans to the Russian Federation before May 31, 2024. This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has made an official statement about her travel plans to the Russian Federation before May 31, 2024. Then, will the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Evghenia Guțul does not make an official statement regarding her travel plans to the Russian Federation before May 31, 2024, will she travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there are no credible sources reporting that Evghenia Guțul has made an official statement about her travel plans to the Russian Federation before May 31, 2024. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

Q.title: Will Evghenia Guțul meet with a Russian official during her visit to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has met with a Russian official during her travel to Russian territory between April 24, 2024, and June 1, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that Evghenia Guțul will meet with a Russian official during her visit to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024, will she also travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has met with a Russian official during her travel to Russian territory between April 24, 2024, and June 1, 2024. Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Evghenia Guțul does not meet with a Russian official, will she still travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question considers the scenario where Evghenia Guțul does not meet with a Russian official during her visit to Russian territory between April 24, 2024, and June 1, 2024. It will resolve as Yes if there are no credible sources reporting that Evghenia Guțul has met with a Russian official during her travel to Russian territory in that timeframe. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

metadata.background_info: [Reporting suggests](https://www.politico.eu/article/russian-victory-over-ukranian-key-city-chasiv-yar-jeopardize-entire-donetsk-region/) that the Ukrainian military sees the city of Chasiv Yar as strategically significant, and that the capture of the city could jeopardize the remaining key cities in the [Donetsk oblast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast). Ukraine has [reportedly said](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/why-is-russia-trying-capture-ukrainian-town-chasiv-yar-2024-04-16/) that Russia aims to capture the city by May 9.

Q.title: Will Ukraine reclaim control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as assessed Ukrainian control or any category indicating Ukrainian territorial gains.

P_given_Q.title: Given Ukraine reclaims control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Ukraine does not reclaim control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Ukraine not reclaim control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as assessed Ukrainian control or any category indicating Ukrainian territorial gains. Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

Q.title: Will Ukraine successfully counterattack and regain control of Chasiv Yar before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Ukrainian control, indicating a successful counterattack.

P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Ukraine does not successfully counterattack and regain control of Chasiv Yar before June 1, 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

Resolution criterion for the condition: This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Ukrainian control, indicating an unsuccessful counterattack.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

metadata.background_info:
In April 29, 2024, Axios [reported](https://www.axios.com/2024/04/29/netanyahu-biden-icc-arrest-warrants-war-crimes) that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked US President Joe Biden to help prevent the International Criminal Court (ICC) in The Hague from issuing arrest warrants for Israeli cabinet officials stemming from possible allegations of war crimes in Gaza. NBC [reported](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-fears-icc-issue-arrest-warrants-netanyahu-gaza-war-hamas-rcna149739) that these arrest warrants could come as early as this week, and Israel is working through back channels to try to prevent them from being issued. The US and other G7 countries are [reportedly](https://www.timesofisrael.com/report-several-nations-urging-icc-not-to-issue-arrest-warrants-for-israelis/) campaigning to dissuade the ICC from issuing the warrants so as to avoid jeopardizing a peace deal between Israel and Hamas.

As the ICC [explains](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) on its official website, an arrest warrant is requested by the Prosecutor as part of the investigative stage before trial, especially in cases in which suspects do not appear voluntarily.

The ICC [was founded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court) in 2002 following the wars in Rwanda and the former Yugoslavia, and it is [intended](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2024/04/29/icc-israel-warrants-gaza/) as a permanent court to investigate war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity done by individuals. It issued its first arrest warrants in 2005, and according to the AP [has issued](https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-gaza-international-criminal-court-hague-palestinians-1f683a6e2e150d91c415eb1d0a19a44d) a total of 42 arrest warrants. Last year the ICC issued arrest warrants for [Vladimir Putin](https://www.icc-cpi.int/news/situation-ukraine-icc-judges-issue-arrest-warrants-against-vladimir-vladimirovich-putin-and) and one of his government officials stemming from the ICC's investigation into the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.

See Also

Base rate information at Wikipedia: [International Criminal Court investigations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court_investigations)

Q.title: Will the International Criminal Court issue an arrest warrant for any other political leaders in the Middle East before July 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any political leaders in the Middle East, excluding the listed Israeli leaders, before July 1, 2024. It will resolve as No otherwise.

P_given_Q.title: Given that the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any other political leaders in the Middle East before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court also issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders before that date?
P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any political leaders in the Middle East, excluding the listed Israeli leaders, before July 1, 2024, and also issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members before the same date. It will resolve as No otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Resolution criteria: 
1. The ICC must issue a warrant of arrest for any political leaders in the Middle East (excluding the listed Israeli leaders) before July 1, 2024. 
2. The ICC must also issue a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that the International Criminal Court will not issue an arrest warrant for any other political leaders in the Middle East before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, given that the ICC does not issue a warrant of arrest for any political leaders in the Middle East (excluding the listed Israeli leaders) before July 1, 2024, the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members:

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

It will resolve as No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for P: The ICC does not issue a warrant of arrest for any political leaders in the Middle East before July 1, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Q: The ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024.

Q.title: Will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any Palestinian leaders before July 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any Palestinian leaders. It will resolve as No otherwise.

P_given_Q.title: Given that the International Criminal Court issues arrest warrants for any Palestinian leaders before July 1, 2024, will it also issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders before the same date?
P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any Palestinian leaders and also issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any Palestinian leaders. It will resolve as No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve as Yes if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members:

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

P_given_not_Q.title: Given the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for any Palestinian leaders before July 1, 2024, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as No otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Resolution criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any Palestinian leaders. It will resolve as No otherwise.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

metadata.background_info:
The [Crimean Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_Bridge) crosses the [Kerch Strait](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerch_Strait) between the Crimean peninsula and the Russian mainland. The bridge is [approximately 12 miles long](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/may/15/putin-opens-bridge-between-crimea-and-russian-mainland) and consists of a separated four-lane road bridge and a two-track rail bridge. Since the Russian invasion of Ukraine the Crimean Bridge has been [attacked three times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_Bridge#Attacks_during_the_Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine), with attacks successfully damaging the bridge in October of 2022 and July of 2023, and the third attack failing to strike the bridge in August of 2023.

In April of 2024 there were reports that Ukraine is planning another attack on the Crimean Bridge. On April 4, 2024, [The Guardian reported](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/apr/03/ukraine-eyes-kerch-bridge-crimea-drone-attack):

>The HUR [[Defense Intelligence of Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Directorate_of_Intelligence_(Ukraine))] thinks it can disable the bridge soon. “We will do it in the first half of 2024,” one official told the Guardian, adding that Kyrylo Budanov, the head of the main directorate of intelligence, already had “most of the means to carry out this goal”. He was following a plan approved by Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, to “minimise” Russia’s naval presence in the Black Sea.

On April 26, 2024, [Newsweek reported](https://www.newsweek.com/ukraine-decoy-missiles-crimea-bridge-attack-rybar-1894639) that an attack could coincide with Russian President Vladimir Putin's [May 7 inauguration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Russian_presidential_election#:~:text=He%20is%20scheduled%20to%20be%20inaugurated%20on%207%20May%202024.):

>[Telegram channel] Rybar said an attack on the Kerch Bridge could happen before the inauguration of Putin on May 7. The Russian leader last month secured his fifth term in office.
>
>"Considering the love of the Ukrainian authorities and their curators for symbolism, the target once again may be the Crimean Bridge, the attention to which is very high," Rybar said.
>
>The analysis comes after Russian military expert Vladislav Shurygin said on state TV that he believes Ukraine will attack the Kerch Strait Bridge on May 7.

reformat_metaculus_question.original_question: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before the listed dates? (July 1, 2024)
reformat_metaculus_question.original_body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Q.title: Will there be a significant increase in military activity in the Black Sea region before June 30, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report a marked increase in military operations, including naval or aerial maneuvers, in the Black Sea region before the specified date.

P_given_Q.title: Given a significant increase in military activity in the Black Sea region, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report a marked increase in military operations, including naval or aerial maneuvers, in the Black Sea region before June 30, 2024. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given there is no significant increase in military activity in the Black Sea region before June 30, 2024, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there are no credible sources reporting a marked increase in military operations, including naval or aerial maneuvers, in the Black Sea region before June 30, 2024, and if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Q.title: Will there be a significant military escalation in the region involving Ukraine before June 30, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report a significant increase in military activities or engagements involving Ukrainian forces and opposing forces before the listed date.

P_given_Q.title: Given a significant military escalation in the region involving Ukraine, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report a significant increase in military activities or engagements involving Ukrainian forces and opposing forces before June 30, 2024. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given no significant military escalation involving Ukraine, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: There are no credible sources reporting a significant increase in military activities or engagements involving Ukrainian forces and opposing forces before June 30, 2024. Then is it true that, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if there are no credible sources reporting a significant increase in military activities or engagements involving Ukrainian forces and opposing forces before June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck.

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

metadata.background_info:
On May 6, 2024, Columbia University [cancelled](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/05/06/columbia-commencement-ceremony-protest-live-updates/73583447007/) its main commencement ceremony, opting instead to honor its graduates in 19 smaller ceremonies for each of its colleges. The decision was made in response to pro-Palestinian protests that erupted at the university. 

UCLA has [cancelled in-person classes](https://www.cbsnews.com/losangeles/news/ucla-cancel-in-person-classes-again-after-more-israel-hamas-war-protests/) at its campus, and there has been speculation that it may cancel its main commencement as well. Its fellow southern California school, USC, recently [moved its ceremony](https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2024-05-03/usc-shores-up-campus-limits-access-before-commencement) to the LA Coliseum.

See Also: 

MSN: [Pro-Palestinian Protests Put College Commencements in Jeopardy](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/pro-palestinian-protests-put-college-commencements-in-jeopardy/ar-BB1lUU4h)

Newsweek: [Full List of Colleges Cancelling Graduation Services Amid Campus Protests](https://www.newsweek.com/columbia-cancels-graduation-ceremony-universities-palestine-protests-1897560)

USA Today: [College graduation canceled due to anti-war protests? It's happened before](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/education/2024/05/07/why-do-colleges-cancel-graduation-a-brief-history/73586349007/)

Q.title: Will UCLA announce any changes to its graduation commencement ceremonies by May 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if UCLA announces any changes to the planned in-person graduation commencement ceremonies for the Class of 2024 on or before May 1, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given UCLA announces any changes to its graduation commencement ceremonies by May 1, 2024, will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if UCLA announces any changes to the planned in-person graduation commencement ceremonies for the Class of 2024 on or before May 1, 2024. 

If UCLA does announce changes, this question will resolve as Yes if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 scheduled for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as No if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

P_given_not_Q.title: Given UCLA does not announce any changes to its graduation commencement ceremonies by May 1, 2024, will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if UCLA does not announce any changes to the planned in-person graduation commencement ceremonies for the Class of 2024 on or before May 1, 2024. Additionally, it resolves as Yes if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 scheduled for June 14, 2024, at the following times and locations:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. This question will resolve as No if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
In late 2021 member states of the World Health Organization (WHO) [began negotiating an international agreement on pandemic prevention, preparedness, and response](https://www.kff.org/global-health-policy/issue-brief/the-pandemic-agreement-what-it-is-what-it-isnt-and-what-it-could-mean-for-the-u-s), which has been known as the Pandemic Agreement or Pandemic Accord. The [goal of the agreement](https://www.who.int/news/item/01-12-2021-world-health-assembly-agrees-to-launch-process-to-develop-historic-global-accord-on-pandemic-prevention-preparedness-and-response) is to improve responsiveness to better combat future pandemics using lessons learned from the COVID-19 response.

A [round of negotiations](https://www.who.int/news/item/28-03-2024-who-member-states-agree-to-resume-negotiations-aimed-at-finalizing-the-world-s-first-pandemic-agreement) aimed at finalizing the agreement began on April 29, 2024, and are scheduled to end on May 10, 2024. The agreement is [scheduled to be considered for adoption](https://www.who.int/news/item/28-03-2024-who-member-states-agree-to-resume-negotiations-aimed-at-finalizing-the-world-s-first-pandemic-agreement) at the upcoming [Seventy-seventh World Health Assembly](https://www.who.int/about/accountability/governance/world-health-assembly/seventy-seventh) taking place May 27 to June 1, 2024.

The level of agreement needed to approve the Pandemic Agreement may depend on the final form of the agreement, [such as whether it would be considered a treaty, regulation, or resolution](https://www.kff.org/global-health-policy/issue-brief/the-pandemic-agreement-what-it-is-what-it-isnt-and-what-it-could-mean-for-the-u-s/#:~:text=What%20are%20possible%20outcomes%20of%20the%20agreement%20negotiations%3F). Politicians in some WHO member countries, including the United States, [have stated opposition](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/who-chief-urges-countries-finalise-pandemic-accord-by-deadline-2024-05-03/) to the agreement on the basis of potentially being subject to legally binding rules within the agreement.

Q.title: Will any major country oppose the Pandemic Agreement during the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any major country publicly opposes the Pandemic Agreement during the discussions at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to reports from credible sources.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any major country opposes the Pandemic Agreement, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any major country publicly opposes the Pandemic Agreement during the discussions at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to reports from credible sources. Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given no major country opposes the Pandemic Agreement, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: No major country publicly opposes the Pandemic Agreement during the discussions at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to reports from credible sources. Then will the Pandemic Agreement be approved in a vote at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to reports from credible sources? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if no major country publicly opposes the Pandemic Agreement. 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote at the May 2024 World Health Assembly.

Q.title: Will any major country announce its support for the Pandemic Agreement before the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

P_given_Q.title: Given that any major country announces its support for the Pandemic Agreement before the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: any major country announces its support for the Pandemic Agreement before the May 2024 World Health Assembly. Then will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no major country announces its support for the Pandemic Agreement before the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. 

Condition: No major country announces its support for the Pandemic Agreement before the May 2024 World Health Assembly.

question.title: Drake vs Kendrick Lamar: will either artist release another diss track in May?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
Popular rappers Drake and Kendrick Lamar have been publicly feuding after a years-long contempt has bubbled into an all-out war, with each artist leveling enormous unsubstantiated accusations at the other. After the most recent round of the beef, with the release of Kendrick's "Not Like Us" and Drake's "The Heart Part 6", many have speculated that the feud has reached a tipping point and neither artist will release any further music. Do you think it's been played out, or there's more yet?

Further Background: [Wikipedia Drake–Kendrick Lamar feud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drake%E2%80%93Kendrick_Lamar_feud)

P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a collaborative track featuring both artists after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024. Additionally, the question resolves as Yes if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024. The resolution criteria for both components are clearly defined.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that neither Drake nor Kendrick Lamar release a collaborative track in May 2024, will either artist release another diss track in May?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if neither Drake nor Kendrick Lamar releases a collaborative track featuring both artists after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.
