Q.title: Will either Drake or Kendrick Lamar release a collaborative track before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if either artist releases a collaborative track featuring the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a collaborative track before June 1, 2024, will either artist release another diss track in May?
P_given_Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if either artist releases a collaborative track featuring the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024. Additionally, the question resolves as **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that neither Drake nor Kendrick Lamar releases a collaborative track before June 1, 2024, will either artist release another diss track in May?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if neither artist releases a collaborative track featuring the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024. Additionally, the question resolves as Yes if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Recently, the national security advisor of the Philippines [called for the expulsion](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippine-calls-chinese-diplomats-be-expelled-disinformation-2024-05-10/) of Chinese diplomats over the leak of a telephone transcript between a Philippine admiral and Chinese officials, in which a Philippine admiral [informally agreed](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-05-07/china-threatens-to-release-audio-of-secret-deal-with-philippines) to certain terms about how the  Philippine Navy would resupply its personnel stationed in disputed areas.  

China and the Philippines have [overlapping claims](https://www.cfr.org/global-conflict-tracker/conflict/territorial-disputes-south-china-sea) to islands in the South China Sea, and in the past several months tensions have been increasing, with China [using](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/south-china-sea-why-are-china-philippines-tensions-heating-up-2024-04-11/) water cannons, collision and ramming tactics, and even a military-grade laser to try to stop the Philippines from resupplying its naval outposts. 

For further background please see [Philippines Considers Expelling Chinese Diplomats After Leaked Transcript](https://hotair.com/john-s-2/2024/05/10/philippines-considers-expelling-chinese-diplomats-after-leaked-audio-n3788194).

Q.title: Will the Philippines and China engage in a high-level diplomatic meeting before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if there is an official announcement or credible report of a high-level diplomatic meeting between representatives of the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024. If no such meeting occurs or is reported, this question resolves as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that the Philippines and China engage in a high-level diplomatic meeting before June 1, 2024, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the two countries before that date?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if there is an official announcement or credible report of a high-level diplomatic meeting between representatives of the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024. If no such meeting occurs or is reported, this question resolves as No. Additionally, this question resolves as Yes if before June 1, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that the Philippines and China do not engage in a high-level diplomatic meeting before June 1, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if there is no official announcement or credible report of a high-level diplomatic meeting between representatives of the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024. If such a meeting occurs or is reported, this question resolves as No.

Additionally, this question resolves as Yes if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Q.title: Will the Philippines engage in a significant diplomatic agreement with another Southeast Asian country before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, the Philippines successfully signs a significant diplomatic agreement with another Southeast Asian country, according to official statements or credible reports. If no such agreement is made, this question resolves as **No**.

P_given_Q.title: Given the Philippines engages in a significant diplomatic agreement with another Southeast Asian country before June 1, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question about the Philippines engaging in a significant diplomatic agreement resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, the Philippines successfully signs a significant diplomatic agreement with another Southeast Asian country, according to official statements or credible reports. If no such agreement is made, this question resolves as **No**.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given the Philippines does not engage in a significant diplomatic agreement with another Southeast Asian country before June 1, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, the Philippines does not successfully sign a significant diplomatic agreement with another Southeast Asian country, according to official statements or credible reports. If such an agreement is made, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

metadata.background_info:
On May 14, 2024, the Biden administration imposed [new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles (EVs) and other goods](https://apnews.com/article/biden-china-tariffs-electric-vehicles-evs-solar-2024ba735c47e04a50898a88425c5e2c), with the EV tariffs increasing to a total level of 102.5% from the previous total of 27.5%. [Analysts have suggested](https://www.cnn.com/2024/05/15/business/us-tariffs-ev-europe-china-trade/index.html) that the new tariffs may put pressure on the European Union (EU) to protect its own EV industry, as the US tariffs may effectively close off the US market, making the EU market more attractive to Chinese EV manufacturers.

The [European Commission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Commission) has been [conducting an anti-subsidy investigation of Chinese EVs](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/04/30/chinese-ev-imports-europe-might-need-to-impose-up-to-55percent-in-tariffs-.html) since [September 2023](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/eu-launches-anti-subsidy-investigation-into-chinese-electric-vehicles-2023-09-13/). The [investigation has a July 4 deadline](https://ec.europa.eu/commission/presscorner/detail/en/ip_23_4752) to impose provisional anti-subsidy duties.

Q.title: Will the European Union implement new environmental regulations affecting electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has implemented new environmental regulations that specifically affect electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given the EU implements new environmental regulations affecting electric vehicles, will the EU announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Union (EU) has implemented new environmental regulations that specifically affect electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. Then, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given the European Union will not implement new environmental regulations affecting electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: The European Union has not implemented new environmental regulations affecting electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Q.title: Will the European Union impose tariffs on other Chinese goods before July 5, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on goods imported from China, excluding electric vehicles.

P_given_Q.title: Given the EU imposes tariffs on other Chinese goods, will the EU announce new tariffs on imports of Chinese electric vehicles?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on goods imported from China, excluding electric vehicles, before July 5, 2024. Then, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on goods imported from China, excluding electric vehicles. 

Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that the European Union will not impose tariffs on other Chinese goods before July 5, 2024, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. The condition is that no credible sources report that the European Union has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on goods imported from China, excluding electric vehicles, before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024?
question.body:
The question will be resolved as **YES** if [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.

Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

metadata.background_info:
On May 15th, Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico (SMER-SD party) was targeted in an [assassination attempt](https://apnews.com/article/slovakia-prime-minister-shooting-fico-23faba11c0f371ef0f69a34861337ae0) after leaving a governmental meeting in the town of Handlová. The assailant, Juraj Cintula, managed to fire at least five bullets from very close proximity before being subdued. Prime Minister Fico was urgently taken to the hospital; his [condition](https://www.cbsnews.com/miami/news/slovakia-prime-minister-robert-fico-shot/?intcid=CNR-02-0623) remains serious but stable.

Just a few hours after the attack, the Deputy Chairman of the Slovak Parliament, Ľuboš Blaho (SMER-SD party), in an emotional speech, blamed the ["liberal media"](https://www.irozhlas.cz/zpravy-svet/nejvetsi-radikalove-vladni-koalice-obvinili-z-atentatu-na-fica-media-a-opozici_2405151955_jgr) and the political opposition for inciting the shooter. Concurrently, Andrej Danko, leader of the SNS party, which is a member of the ruling coalition, echoed this sentiment.

Robert Kaliňák, the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence, has been the most prominent figure in the aftermath, with his statements also targeting the media and political opposition.

Outgoing Slovak President Zuzana Čaputová and newly elected President Peter Pellegrini have called for societal calm and are orchestrating a [meeting](https://www.ceskenoviny.cz/zpravy/caputova-a-pellegrini-vyzvali-k-opusteni-bludneho-kruhu-nenavisti/2519316) with all major political entities in Slovakia, scheduled for May 21. However, so far, all governmental parties have either not responded or declined the invitation.

To date, apart from the shooter, only one individual has been charged in connection with the assassination attempt, and it was for spreading online hate. Paradoxically, despite the framing by the governmental politicians, the shooter was no fan of the liberal opposition and reportedly also a member of the recently disbanded ["Slovenskí Branci"](https://www.euronews.com/2024/05/15/what-is-known-about-suspect-allegedly-involved-in-shooting-of-robert-fico) paramilitary group, which had ties to Russia.

Q.title: Will any government official in Slovakia be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a government official has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt. Alternatively, it will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect.

P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico. 

Alternatively, it will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect. 

Resolution criteria: 
1. The condition is that any government official in Slovakia must be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024.
2. The outcome resolves YES if a Slovak journalist or opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt before June 15, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no government official in Slovakia will be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as YES if no credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a government official has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024. 

Additionally, the question will resolve as YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.

Alternatively, it will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions do not issue a statement regarding government officials being charged and do issue a statement that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been charged. 

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as NO.

Q.title: Will any government official in Slovakia be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a government official has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico. Alternatively, the resolution will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect. Otherwise, the question will be resolved as NO.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any government official in Slovakia is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, will a journalist or an opposition politician also be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a government official has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico. Additionally, it will resolve as YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt. Alternatively, the resolution will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect regarding either the government official or the journalist/opposition politician. Otherwise, the question will be resolved as NO.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no government official in Slovakia is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as YES if no credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a government official has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on PM Robert Fico. Alternatively, the resolution will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions do not issue a statement to that effect. 

Furthermore, the question will resolve as YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt. Alternatively, it will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect. 

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Recently, the national security advisor of the Philippines [called for the expulsion](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippine-calls-chinese-diplomats-be-expelled-disinformation-2024-05-10/) of Chinese diplomats over the leak of a telephone transcript between a Philippine admiral and Chinese officials, in which a Philippine admiral [informally agreed](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-05-07/china-threatens-to-release-audio-of-secret-deal-with-philippines) to certain terms about how the  Philippine Navy would resupply its personnel stationed in disputed areas.  

China and the Philippines have [overlapping claims](https://www.cfr.org/global-conflict-tracker/conflict/territorial-disputes-south-china-sea) to islands in the South China Sea, and in the past several months tensions have been increasing, with China [using](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/south-china-sea-why-are-china-philippines-tensions-heating-up-2024-04-11/) water cannons, collision and ramming tactics, and even a military-grade laser to try to stop the Philippines from resupplying its naval outposts. 

For further background please see [Philippines Considers Expelling Chinese Diplomats After Leaked Transcript](https://hotair.com/john-s-2/2024/05/10/philippines-considers-expelling-chinese-diplomats-after-leaked-audio-n3788194).

Q.title: Will the Philippines and China sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if the Philippines and China officially sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024. If no such agreement is signed by that date, this question resolves as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given the Philippines and China sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if the Philippines and China officially sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024. If no such agreement is signed by that date, this question resolves as No. Additionally, this question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that the Philippines and China do not sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before that date?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if the Philippines and China do not officially sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024. If such an agreement is signed by that date, this question resolves as No. Additionally, this question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Q.title: Will the Philippines and China sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if a new trade agreement between the Philippines and China is officially signed and announced before August 1, 2024. If no agreement is signed by that date, this question resolves as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that the Philippines and China sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if a new trade agreement between the Philippines and China is officially signed and announced before August 1, 2024. If no agreement is signed by that date, this question resolves as No. Additionally, this question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given the Philippines and China do not sign a new trade agreement before August 1, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if no new trade agreement between the Philippines and China is officially signed and announced before August 1, 2024, and before that date, one of the following four events occurs, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

question.title: Will the International Seabed Authority Secretary-General Michael Lodge be re-elected for a third term in the July elections?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise it will resolve **No**.

metadata.background_info:
The [International Seabed Authority (ISA)](https://www.isa.org.jm/about-isa/) describes itself as:

>an autonomous international organization established under the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) and the 1994 Agreement relating to the Implementation of Part XI of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea.

It describes itself as:

>[an] organization through which States Parties to UNCLOS organize and control all mineral-resources-related activities in the Area for the benefit of humankind as a whole.

This means the ISA controls regulations on [Deep Sea Mining (DSM)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_sea_mining) which has slowly become a massively contentious issue between nations, NGOs, and companies due to the fact that, whilst DSM will potentially allow mining companies to access vast amount of minerals critical in the manufacturing of renewable energy systems, electric vehicles, and batteries, those who oppose DSM see it resulting in long-term harm to ecosystems already at risk due to environmental deviations arising from global warming. 

The Secretary-General incumbent is the British national Michael Lodge who is seeking his third term in the upcoming July elections. Tood Woody, via Bloomberg describes his history at the ISA:

>Lodge’s candidacy emerged Sunday in a diplomatic note from ISA member state Kiribati, a small South Pacific island nation that announced it would sponsor Lodge’s nomination. Candidates for secretary-general are usually sponsored by their country of citizenship: The UK sponsored Lodge’s first term as secretary-general (though his election to a second term, which happened under a “silent procedure” during the Covid-19 pandemic, is less clear). Carvalho, an official with UN Environment Programme in Nairobi, was likewise put forth by Brazil’s delegate in March.

Notably, the UK was a signatory of a [memorandum](https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-supports-moratorium-on-deep-sea-mining-to-protect-ocean-and-marine-ecosystems) against DSM. However, as noted in the above article, Lodge has found support of island nations - such as Kiribati - who stand to benefit immensely from DSM.

One DSM company - [The Metals Company (TMC)](https://metals.co) - has been a major supporter of DSM and has carried out extensive environmental studies supporting its position of allowing the practice.  TMC has also carried out [pilot studies](https://metals.co/nori/) in the Clarion-Clipper Zone (CCZ) with Allseas' dedicated Deep Sea Mining Vessel "*Hidden Gem*" which were successful.

See also Southern Fried Science: [International Seabed Authority gears up for a leadership challenge at the July meeting.](https://www.southernfriedscience.com/international-seabed-authority-gears-up-for-a-leadership-challenge-at-the-july-meeting/)

Q.title: Will any other candidates challenge Michael Lodge in the July elections?
Q.body: This question will resolve **Yes** if credible sources report that one or more candidates have officially announced their intention to run against Michael Lodge in the July elections. It will resolve **No** if no candidates are reported to challenge him.

P_given_Q.title: Given that there are candidates challenging Michael Lodge, will he be re-elected for a third term in the July elections?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve **Yes** if credible sources report that one or more candidates have officially announced their intention to run against Michael Lodge in the July elections. It will resolve **No** if no candidates are reported to challenge him. Furthermore, the question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise, it will resolve **No**.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no other candidates challenge Michael Lodge in the July elections, will Michael Lodge be re-elected for a third term?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: No credible sources report that one or more candidates have officially announced their intention to run against Michael Lodge in the July elections. Then, will the International Seabed Authority Secretary-General Michael Lodge be re-elected for a third term in the July elections? The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise, it will resolve **No**.

Q.title: Will any other candidate receive more votes than Michael Lodge in the July elections?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any candidate other than the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge receives more votes than him in the July elections. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any other candidate receives more votes than Michael Lodge, will Michael Lodge be re-elected for a third term in the July elections?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any candidate other than the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge receives more votes than him in the July elections. This will be the condition (P). The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise it will resolve **No**. This will be the outcome (Q).

P_given_not_Q.title: Given no other candidate receives more votes than Michael Lodge, will he be re-elected for a third term?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: No other candidate receives more votes than the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge in the July elections. Then will the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections? 

Resolution criteria: The first question resolves as Yes if no candidate other than Michael Lodge receives more votes than him. The second question resolves as Yes if Michael Lodge is reported as elected for a third term by the ISA and/or credible sources. Otherwise, both will resolve as No.

question.title: Will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti.

metadata.background_info:
Violence and unrest have been on the rise in Haiti, resulting in former Haitian Prime Minister Ariel Henry being blocked from returning to his country and eventually resigning in March of 2023. A [multinational mission](https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/05/1149831) to provide security assistance has been in the works since 2023. Forces from Kenya's [General Service Unit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Service_Unit_(Kenya)) (GSU), a branch of the [Kenya Police Service](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya_Police) are [planned to deploy to Haiti](https://globalinitiative.net/analysis/green-light-for-kenyan-police-boots-on-the-ground-in-haiti/) as part of this effort. However, the deployment of the Kenyan police has faced several setbacks, including [legal challenges](https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/kenyan-lawyers-ask-court-hold-government-contempt-planned-police-deployment-2024-05-17/) and [political opposition](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/mar/28/kenya-plan-deploy-police-haiti) in Kenya.

On May 22, 2024, it was [reported](https://www.cnn.com/2024/05/21/americas/kenya-haiti-delegation-intl-latam/index.html) that Kenyan officials had arrived in Haiti to assess readiness to receive the Kenyan police forces, who are scheduled to arrive by the end of the month. However, [recent reporting has also suggested the potential for additional delays](https://ca.news.yahoo.com/kenya-police-deployment-haiti-faces-130709387.html).

Q.title: Will other countries send military or police personnel to Haiti before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that military or police personnel from countries other than Kenya have arrived in Haiti.

P_given_Q.title: Given that other countries send military or police personnel to Haiti before June 1, 2024, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that military or police personnel from countries other than Kenya have arrived in Haiti. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no other countries send military or police personnel to Haiti before June 1, 2024, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, there are no credible sources reporting that military or police personnel from countries other than Kenya have arrived in Haiti. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti during the same time frame.

Q.title: Will other countries send military or police personnel to Haiti before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that military or police personnel from any country other than Kenya have arrived in Haiti.

P_given_Q.title: Given that other countries send military or police personnel to Haiti before June 1, 2024, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that military or police personnel from any country other than Kenya have arrived in Haiti. Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that other countries will not send military or police personnel to Haiti before June 1, 2024, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. 

Condition: This resolves as Yes if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, there are no credible sources reporting that military or police personnel from any country other than Kenya have arrived in Haiti.

question.title: Before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

metadata.background_info:
China has escalated military tensions with Taiwan, launching [large-scale military drills](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/05/22/world/asia/china-taiwan-drills.html) around the island starting on May 23, 2024. These drills were described by China as "punishment" for what it considers separatist acts by Taiwan, and mark a significant test for Taiwan's newly inaugurated leader, [Lai Ching-te](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/5/20/william-lai-ching-te-takes-oath-to-become-taiwans-new-president), who assumed office on May 20, 2024. 

Initial phases of the exercises involved dozens of Chinese fighter jets, destroyers, frigates, and missile speedboats conducting mock strikes against Taiwanese military targets.

Q.title: Will there be a significant military escalation between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible reports confirm a significant increase in military activity or mobilization by either China or Taiwan that indicates an escalation of tensions before June 6, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given there will be a significant military escalation between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible reports confirm a significant increase in military activity or mobilization by either China or Taiwan that indicates an escalation of tensions before June 6, 2024. Furthermore, it will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. Therefore, if there is a significant military escalation (P), does that lead to an armed forces conflict death (Q)?

P_given_not_Q.title: Given there is no significant military escalation between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there are no credible reports confirming a significant increase in military activity or mobilization by either China or Taiwan that indicates an escalation of tensions before June 6, 2024. In addition, it will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. The resolution criteria for both components must be met.

Q.title: Will there be a significant military escalation between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there are credible reports of increased military activity or mobilization by either China or Taiwan that indicates a significant escalation in tensions before June 6, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given there is a significant military escalation between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if there are credible reports of increased military activity or mobilization by either China or Taiwan that indicates a significant escalation in tensions before June 6, 2024. Furthermore, it will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Resolution criteria: Resolves Yes if both conditions are met: (1) there is significant military escalation between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, and (2) there are credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict before June 6, 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given there is no significant military escalation between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if there are no credible reports of increased military activity or mobilization by either China or Taiwan that indicates a significant escalation in tensions before June 6, 2024. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. 

Resolution criteria: 
- For P: There must be no credible reports of increased military activity or mobilization indicating significant escalation before June 6, 2024. 
- For Q: There must be credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict before June 6, 2024.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

metadata.background_info:
[Rishi Sunak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rishi_Sunak?useskin=vector), born 12 May 1980, is a British politician who has served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party since 2022. Sunak has been Member of Parliament for [Richmond (Yorks)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richmond_(Yorks)_(UK_Parliament_constituency)&useskin=vector) since 2015.

In the most recent general election in 2019, [Sunak won his seat](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richmond_(Yorks)_(UK_Parliament_constituency)&useskin=vector#Elections_in_the_2010s) with 63.6% of the vote; the nearest competitor was the Labour Party candidate on 16.4% of the vote. 

Since 2019 the Conservative Party, in power since 2010, has seen a significant decline in its support according to [opinion polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2024_United_Kingdom_general_election?useskin=vector#Graphical_summary); and as of late May 2024, it trails the opposition Labour Party by around 20 points. 

[Sunak's personal approval rating](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leadership_approval_opinion_polling_for_the_2024_United_Kingdom_general_election?useskin=vector) has been in negative territory for nearly his entire tenure as Prime Minister, and is [among the worst for any British Conservative or Labour leader](https://www.ipsos.com/en-uk/rishi-sunaks-satisfaction-falls-equal-worst-ever-ipsos-rating-conservative-or-labour-leader) in Ipsos data going back to 1978.

In May 2024 [Sunak called a snap general election](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-69050450), to be held on July 4.

Sunak is expected to contest the constituency of [Richmond and Northallerton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richmond_and_Northallerton_(UK_Parliament_constituency)?useskin=vector) in the July 4 election, which was created following the [2023 Periodic Review of Westminster constituencies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Periodic_Review_of_Westminster_constituencies?useskin=vector).

Q.title: Will Rishi Sunak be elected as the leader of the Conservative Party again before the 2024 UK General Election?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak is re-elected as leader of the Conservative Party before the July 4, 2024 UK General Election. If he is not re-elected before this date, the question resolves as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given Rishi Sunak is re-elected as leader of the Conservative Party before the 2024 UK General Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If he is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as No. 

Resolution criteria: 
1. The condition is that Rishi Sunak must be re-elected as leader of the Conservative Party before the July 4, 2024 UK General Election. 
2. The outcome resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament, and as No if he is elected.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Rishi Sunak is not re-elected as the leader of the Conservative Party before the 2024 UK General Election, will he fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak is not re-elected as leader of the Conservative Party before the July 4, 2024 UK General Election, and for any reason fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If he is re-elected before this date, the question resolves as No. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as No. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Q.title: Will Rishi Sunak remain the leader of the Conservative Party after the 2024 UK General Election?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak is still the leader of the Conservative Party after the results of the July 4 2024 UK general election are announced. If he resigns or is replaced as leader before the results are announced, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given Rishi Sunak remains the leader of the Conservative Party after the 2024 UK General Election, will he fail to be elected in that election?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If he is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for condition: Rishi Sunak must still be the leader of the Conservative Party after the results of the July 4 2024 UK general election are announced; if he resigns or is replaced as leader before the results are announced, this condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected, and No if he is elected, citing credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Rishi Sunak does not remain the leader of the Conservative Party after the 2024 UK General Election, will he fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak is no longer the leader of the Conservative Party after the results of the July 4 2024 UK general election are announced. If he remains the leader after the results are announced, this question will resolve as No.

Furthermore, this question resolves as Yes if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as No.

Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Elon Musk is the current CEO of Tesla and owns around 13% of the company. During its founding years in 2003 - 2005, Musk invested heavily into the company, eventually becoming chair of the board of directors and one of the largest shareholders; he subsequently became CEO in October 2008. His success at the company has seen Tesla become the 17th largest company in the world by market cap with its share price soaring since its June 2010 IPO.

As a result of his immense success as CEO, a $56 billion pay package to Musk was approved by Tesla's board of the directors in 2018. However, Musk has yet to receive this package, as per the [FT](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1):

>Tesla’s board has been lobbying investors to re-ratify the $56bn award given in 2018, which was struck down by a Delaware judge in January due to concerns over its size and the independence of the board. In response, Musk vowed to leave the state and move Tesla’s incorporation to Texas.

>Tesla chair Robyn Denholm has argued that Musk deserves to be paid so much because the company hit ambitious targets for revenue and its stock price. She brushed off criticism she is too close to the CEO as “crap”.

Aside from the sheer size of the pay package - the largest of its kind - those who oppose it call into question various decisions made by Musk during his tenure as CEO. In particular,  Musk's social media activity has been called into question, and perhaps most notably the:

- Purchase - and subsequent rebrand - of Twitter (now X) for $44 billion which has attracted a lot of negative criticism and has also seen Musk spend a disproportionate amount of time at that company instead of Tesla.

 - Purchase of $1.5 billion of Bitcoin in 2021 and allowing the cryptocurrency to be used by customers for purchasing Tesla automobiles. The company promptly stopped accepting the currency - causing the price to plummet - after which Tesla announced they had sold almost all of their Bitcoin holdings at a loss.

During significant shareholder votes like this one, influential proxy advisory firms often send out advice to shareholders on what to vote and why. According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_firm):

>A proxy firm provides services to shareholders (in most cases an institutional investor of some type) to vote their shares at shareholder meetings of, usually, listed companies.

The two largest proxy advisory firms are ISS and Glass Lewis. The latter has [advised](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1) shareholders *not* to vote in favour of Musk's package as well as advising shareholders to vote against the re-election of Kimbal Musk - brother of Elon Musk - from the board of directors. The ISS, however, has yet to issue any advice with respect to the June 13 shareholder meeting.

---------------------

See related question:

[*Will a non-Disney-nominated board member be elected to Disney's board at the April 3, 2024, shareholder meeting?*](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21972/non-disney-board-member-elected-april-2024/)

Q.title: Will any other major proxy advisory firm recommend against Elon Musk's compensation package before the Tesla shareholder meeting in June 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any major proxy advisory firm (such as Glass Lewis or others) publicly recommends that Tesla shareholders vote against Elon Musk's pay package before the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any major proxy advisory firm recommends against Elon Musk's compensation package, will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Any major proxy advisory firm (such as Glass Lewis or others) publicly recommends that Tesla shareholders vote against Elon Musk's pay package before the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting. Then, will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors? 

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves Yes if any major proxy advisory firm recommends against Elon Musk's pay package. Resolves No otherwise. 
Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves Yes if ISS advises against either Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves No otherwise.

Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that a major institutional investor publicly expresses opposition to Elon Musk's $57 billion package before the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting, will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if any major institutional investor publicly states their opposition to Elon Musk's pay package before the shareholder meeting. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

Moreover, the question will resolve as Yes if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no major institutional investor publicly expresses opposition to Elon Musk's $57 billion package before the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting, will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question considers the scenario where no major institutional investor publicly states their opposition to Elon Musk's pay package before the shareholder meeting. It will resolve as Yes if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

metadata.background_info:
Since late 2022, Nvidia Corporation has experienced nearly 10x growth in market capitalization, driven by its [dominance in the AI chip market](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nvidias-ai-chip-dominance-continue-210200974.html). Nvidia's GPUs are critical in the development of large language models, and are highly sought after by major tech companies like OpenAI, Microsoft, Amazon, and Alphabet.

On May 22nd, Nvidia released [impressive Q1 financial results](https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-first-quarter-fiscal-2025#:~:text=NVIDIA%20(NASDAQ%3A%20NVDA)%20today,262%25%20from%20a%20year%20ago.) and simultaneously announced a 10:1 stock split and increase to its dividend, sending its stock price to new all-time highs.

question.title: Will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
South Africa's 2024 national election, held on May 29, is highly contested, with the long-ruling African National Congress (ANC) potentially losing its majority in Parliament for the first time in 30 years. The president of South Africa is elected by Parliament, specifically the National Assembly, requiring a simple majority of 201 out of 400 lawmakers. Due to the [ANC's declining support](https://apnews.com/article/south-africa-election-president-vote-bb5529f8ec76f40f0bebdff67bfd2320), coalition talks are anticipated, which could delay the election of the president.

The results of the national election held on May 29, 2024, are expected to be announced by the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) by the Sunday following the election, and the new Parliament [must hold its first session within 14 days of the announcement of the election results](https://apnews.com/article/south-africa-election-president-vote-bb5529f8ec76f40f0bebdff67bfd2320).

Q.title: Will South Africa hold a national election before July 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a national election is held in South Africa and reported by credible sources before July 1, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given South Africa holds a national election before July 1, 2024, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a national election is held in South Africa and reported by credible sources before July 1, 2024. Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. Therefore, if a national election occurs and the assembly elects a president, then the outcome will be Yes.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that South Africa will not hold a national election before July 1, 2024, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a national election is not held in South Africa and reported by credible sources before July 1, 2024. This would imply no election for the National Assembly occurs, meaning there can be no election of a president. The outcome will resolve as Yes if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. Therefore, if there is no national election, it follows that there cannot be an election for president.

Q.title: Will South Africa hold its general elections before July 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the South African government holds its general elections before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

P_given_Q.title: Given South Africa holds its general elections before July 1, 2024, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the South African government holds its general elections before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. If the elections are held, it is expected that the South African National Assembly will officially elect a president shortly thereafter, also before July 1, 2024. Resolution criteria: Resolves Yes if both the general elections and the presidential election occur before July 1, 2024, according to credible sources.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given South Africa does not hold its general elections before July 1, 2024, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the South African government does not hold its general elections before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. Additionally, this question will resolve as **Yes** if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
The Fidesz-KDNP alliance has long been a dominant political force in Hungary, championed by Viktor Orbán's Fidesz and the Christian Democratic People's Party (KDNP). Since 2005, they have secured a significant majority of Hungary's seats in the European Parliament, capitalizing on shared conservative and nationalistic ideologies. 

However, the alliance faces [new challenges](https://apnews.com/article/hungary-orban-eu-election-magyar-fidesz-russia-f53cd35e52a9f91c34b00d8dd6f85694) as Péter Magyar, a former insider of the Fidesz party, breaks ranks and forms his own party, Tisztelet és Szabadság (Respect and Freedom). Magyar's emergence comes at a time when Fidesz is grappling with scandals and a loss of public trust, highlighted by significant resignations within its ranks.

The 2024 European Parliament elections are critical for the alliance as they face increasing internal and EU-wide challenges, including economic pressures and debates over the EU's influence on national policies. These elections will test the alliance's ability to maintain its influence amid growing political diversity and opposition within Hungary.

Q.title: Will any Hungarian political party gain more seats than Fidesz-KDNP in the 2024 European Parliament elections?
Q.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, any Hungarian political party or coalition secures more seats than the Fidesz-KDNP alliance, according to credible sources.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any Hungarian political party gains more seats than Fidesz-KDNP in the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, any Hungarian political party or coalition secures more seats than the Fidesz-KDNP alliance, according to credible sources. Additionally, this question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no Hungarian political party gains more seats than Fidesz-KDNP in the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, no Hungarian political party or coalition secures more seats than the Fidesz-KDNP alliance, according to credible sources. Additionally, this question will also resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

Q.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP secure at least 50% of the Hungarian votes in the 2024 European Parliament elections?
Q.body: This question will resolve to 'Yes' if the Fidesz-KDNP alliance receives more than 50% of the total votes cast in Hungary during the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to credible sources.

P_given_Q.title: Given Fidesz-KDNP secures at least 50% of the Hungarian votes, will they maintain their EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve to 'Yes' if the Fidesz-KDNP alliance receives more than 50% of the total votes cast in Hungary during the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to credible sources. Additionally, it will resolve to 'Yes' if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Fidesz-KDNP will not secure at least 50% of the Hungarian votes in the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve to 'Yes' if the Fidesz-KDNP alliance receives 50% or less of the total votes cast in Hungary during the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to credible sources. If this is true, then will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secure more seats than any other single party or coalition following the 2024 European Parliament elections, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources?

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

metadata.background_info:
On June 4, 2024, a group of current and former employees at frontier AI labs called for "[sweeping changes to the artificial intelligence industry, including greater transparency and protections for whistle-blowers](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/04/technology/openai-culture-whistleblowers.html?unlocked_article_code=1.xE0._mTr.aNO4f_hEp2J4&smid=nytcore-ios-share&referringSource=articleShare&sgrp=c-cb)."

In a public statement titled "[A Right to Warn about Advanced Artificial Intelligence](https://righttowarn.ai/)," the group said:

> We are current and former employees at frontier AI companies, and we believe in the potential of AI technology to deliver unprecedented benefits to humanity.

> We also understand the serious risks posed by these technologies. These risks range from the further entrenchment of existing inequalities, to manipulation and misinformation, to the loss of control of autonomous AI systems potentially resulting in human extinction. AI companies themselves have acknowledged these risks [1, 2, 3], as have governments across the world [4, 5, 6] and other AI experts [7, 8, 9].

> We are hopeful that these risks can be adequately mitigated with sufficient guidance from the scientific community, policymakers, and the public. However, AI companies have strong financial incentives to avoid effective oversight, and we do not believe bespoke structures of corporate governance are sufficient to change this.

> AI companies possess substantial non-public information about the capabilities and limitations of their systems, the adequacy of their protective measures, and the risk levels of different kinds of harm. However, they currently have only weak obligations to share some of this information with governments, and none with civil society. We do not think they can all be relied upon to share it voluntarily.

> So long as there is no effective government oversight of these corporations, current and former employees are among the few people who can hold them accountable to the public. Yet broad confidentiality agreements block us from voicing our concerns, except to the very companies that may be failing to address these issues. Ordinary whistleblower protections are insufficient because they focus on illegal activity, whereas many of the risks we are concerned about are not yet regulated. Some of us reasonably fear various forms of retaliation, given the history of such cases across the industry. We are not the first to encounter or speak about these issues.

> **We therefore call upon advanced AI companies to commit to these principles.**

> 1. **That the company will not enter into or enforce** any agreement that prohibits “disparagement” or criticism of the company for risk-related concerns, nor retaliate for risk-related criticism by hindering any vested economic benefit;
2. **That the company will facilitate a verifiably anonymous process** for current and former employees to raise risk-related concerns to the company’s board, to regulators, and to an appropriate independent organization with relevant expertise;
3. **That the company will support a culture of open criticism** and allow its current and former employees to raise risk-related concerns about its technologies to the public, to the company’s board, to regulators, or to an appropriate independent organization with relevant expertise, so long as trade secrets and other intellectual property interests are appropriately protected;
4. **That the company will not retaliate against current and former employees who publicly share risk-related confidential information after other processes have failed.** We accept that any effort to report risk-related concerns should avoid releasing confidential information unnecessarily. Therefore, once an adequate process for anonymously raising concerns to the company’s board, to regulators, and to an appropriate independent organization with relevant expertise exists, we accept that concerns should be raised through such a process initially. However, as long as such a process does not exist, current and former employees should retain their freedom to report their concerns to the public.

reformat_metaculus_question.original_body:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the indicated ["right to warn" principle](https://righttowarn.ai/#:~:text=We%20therefore%20call%20upon%20advanced%20AI%20companies%20to%20commit%20to%20these%20principles%3A) via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time that the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of [righttowarn.ai](https://righttowarn.ai/). Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for a given sub question to resolve as **Yes**.
